locations: Manhattan, New York City, New York, USA
imdb.plot outline: This mobile app presents a live, interactive game show which is presented at least once per day. While the format occasionally varies, a typical show presents 12 multiple choice questions, each with three possible answers, with viewer/players having only 10 seconds to select one answer. After each question, the host (most often Scott Rogowsky) reveals the correct answer, and the number of players who selected each of the responses is displayed. A viewer/player must answer each question correctly to remain in the game; wrong answers result in the player being eliminated from the competition for that game. An episode which starts out with hundreds of thousands of players might wind up with only a few hundred players correctly answering all 12 questions; the prize for the game (say, $5,000) is then divided equally among all of the winners.
imdb.title: HQ
plot: A live, interactive game show in the form of a mobile app, where the jackpot for each episode is divided among all the players who got all the answers right.::Anonymous

This mobile app presents a live, interactive game show which is presented at least once per day. While the format occasionally varies, a typical show presents 12 multiple choice questions, each with three possible answers, with viewer/players having only 10 seconds to select one answer. After each question, the host (most often Scott Rogowsky) reveals the correct answer, and the number of players who selected each of the responses is displayed. A viewer/player must answer each question correctly to remain in the game; wrong answers result in the player being eliminated from the competition for that game. An episode which starts out with hundreds of thousands of players might wind up with only a few hundred players correctly answering all 12 questions; the prize for the game (say, $5,000) is then divided equally among all of the winners.
